title: Tools for managing blood glucose numbers
content: The five main tools for managing blood glucose numbers are nutrition, exercise, management of stress, sleep, and medications/supplements. Starting with the most powerful levers, nutrition, sleep, and exercise can be used to manipulate glucose levels. A given person can have two totally different carbohydrate tolerances depending on their activity levels.

title: Personal example of carbohydrate tolerance
content: Peter shares a personal example of consuming 600 grams of carbohydrates a day while cycling 28 hours a week with no issues maintaining normal glucose homeostasis. However, if he were to consume the same amount of carbohydrates now while exercising only 10 hours a week, his glucose levels would not look nearly as good.

title: Importance of sleep for managing blood glucose
content: Sleep cannot be overlooked when managing blood glucose levels. Poor sleep has been shown to cause insulin resistance, resulting in hyperglycemia. Even short-term bouts of sleep deprivation can result in a 50% reduction in glucose disposal. Additionally, sleep deprivation can affect other downstream factors such as motivation to exercise, willpower to avoid unhealthy food, and stress/anxiety levels.
